ext_description.p: An Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship is the association between a geometric model of an , as a target, and a geometric model of a , as the source. This relationship positions and orients the source into the target using a transformation. The source is a model of a connection area associated with a design specific terminal created in the assembly.
ext_description.note:
There can be only one terminal that uses the
referenced so there is no need to reference the terminal in this relationship.

The terminal that uses the
is a terminal of a component in the assembly.

ext_description.p:
specifies the role of the
for the Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship.

for the Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship.

for the Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship.

for the Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship.

for the Assembly_connection_zone_position_relationship.

A Routed_interconnect_component is a type of . The functionality of a Routed_interconnect_component shall be that of a short. The domain of the short depends on the material properties of the Routed_interconnect_component.

example.p: A wire or a jumper or a continuously deposited conductive paste that is included in the design may be represented as a Routed_interconnect_component.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
specifies the role of the
for the Routed_interconnect_component.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
A Component_feature_external_reference is an unambiguous reference to a
in a different design.

example.p:
Items in an
may need to reference component features in a reference assembly in order to unambiguously identify source of layout requirements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the words by which the Component_feature_external_reference is known.

specifies the role of the
for the Component_feature_external_reference.
The combination of associated_component and name shall be unique within a population of Component_feature_external_reference.

ext_description.p: A Component_external_reference is an unambiguous reference to a in a different design.

example.p: Items in an may need to reference component to assembly relationships in the assembly in order to unambiguously identify the source of layout requirements.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The reference_designation uniquely identifies the externally referenced component in the reference assembly.

specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The product_definition_id identifies the original for the assembly. If not available in the originating system, the string "UNKNOWN" shall be provided.

ext_description.p: specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The revision_code identifies the version of the reference assembly.

note.p: Usually the revision_code and part_number identify the original assembly for which an interconnect is designed.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The part_number identifies the reference assembly in the context of the design_owner.

specifies text for the Component_external_reference. The design_owner is the organization that maintains the registration document for the part_number for the reference assembly. Usually it is the design authority.

A Packaged_component is a type of
and a type of . A Packaged_component is an instantiation of a
at a given location within the context of an assembly.

specifies an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Packaged_component is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Packaged_component as its . There shall be zero or more for a Packaged_component.

specifies the role of the
for the Packaged_component. The value of this attribute overrides the
when the size of that attribute is one or selects a specific item when there are more than one in the aggregate. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

A Bare_die_component_terminal is a type of
that is an instance of a . The Bare_die_component_terminal is the area on the bare die instance onto which an enterprise will place bond wires, thereby joining the active areas on the die instance to the next level of assembly. It is not necessarily the shape of the land itself on the die.

specifies the
to which the Bare_die_component_terminal provides electrical access.

specifies the role of the
for the Bare_die_component_terminal.

The
shall not be populated.

A Minimally_defined_component_terminal is a type of
that is included to permit references to terminals without including geometric representations of the terminals.

specifies the role of the
for the Minimally_defined_component_terminal.

The
shall not be populated.

ext_description.p:
An Assembly_module_design_view is a type of
and a type of . An Assembly_module_design_view may be either a
or a . An Assembly_module_design_view is a view of a product sufficiently detailed for a manufacturer to assemble the materials that compose the product into a form suitable for customer delivery. An Assembly_module_design_view is also a design view of a product, that is, a view created by a design organization for manufacturing. This application object supports design reuse, modular product definitions, component libraries, and related technologies. There may be discipline views that further specialize this view.
ext_description.note: A design organization may create several product views during the development process. Not all views are intended for manufacturing purposes.

example.p: Figure 1 is an illustration of an Assembly_module_design_view.

ext_description.note:
An Assembly_module_design_view could be a ball grid array design, an MCM design, a disk drive design, a line card or plug-in module in a telecommunications rack, or a line replaceable unit in an airframe or spacecraft. Incomplete designs that have some specified functionality as defined by a functional definition may be included in a component library application, for example. The designs may be included in an active design by reference. At the appropriate time in the design phase, the single reference is replaced with individual references to the elements that compose the Assembly_module_design_view. Support is provided for maintaining the information necessary to trace back to the original Assembly_module_design_view from the released
through the .

Additional
categories other than , such as MCM-L (Multichip Module, Laminated), MCM-D (Multichip Module, Deposited) and MCM-C (Multichip Module, Ceramic) may be included through the use of this application object, and population of the application objects.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The
shall not be populated.

A Component_mounting_clearance_relationship is the relationship between the features of one component and another in their next assembly, with respect to the clearance between them.
This clearance is required when a specific component requires a minimum distance from the printed circuit board or another specific component.
This clearance is often derived from the mechanism requirements of the factory equipment that assembles the components to their next assembly. The mechanical handling fingers that grasp and place a component require clearance from previously placed components in order to place the second component and release it from the mechanism.

specifies the role of the
for the Component_mounting_clearance_relationship. The value shall be interpreted as the specification to be satisfied by the assembly process.

specifies the role of the
for the Component_mounting_clearance_relationship.
A Component_mounting_feature is a type of intended for mounting purposes where the definition is a .

an attribute inherited from the
shall be redeclared as for the Component_mounting_feature.

A Component_overlap_relationship is the relationship between one component and another in their next assembly, with respect to the physical overlap between them. This overlap is often derived from the mechanism requirements of the factory equipment that assembles the components to their next assembly. The sequence of assembly is established by the previously_placed_component and the current_component, in turn, and the minimum clearance between the two components is taken into consideration during assembly.

specifies the
of the distance between the current_component and the previously_placed_component for the Component_overlap_relationship.
specifies the , of the component to be placed next, for the Component_overlap_relationship.
specifies the , of the component previously placed, for the Component_overlap_relationship.

being terminated.

example.p: Figure 3 illustrates a detail of an assembly drawing that shows a microcircuit plugged into a socket, and the role of the Packaged_component_join_terminal.

ext_description.p: A Layered_assembly_module_design_view is a type of . A Layered_assembly_module_design_view describes a printed circuit assembly. A printed circuit assembly is nearly a synonym for printed wiring assembly, except that a printed circuit assembly may include printed components in its printed circuit board and a printed wiring assembly is constructed upon a printed wiring board that is totally interconnect without printed components. Another synonym for printed circuit assembly is circuit card assembly.

example.p: See figure 2 for an illustration of a Layered_assembly_module_design_view.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the , as seen from the context of its next assembly, for the Layered_assembly_module_design_view.

ext_description.p:
A Routed_physical_component is a type of
whose shape is design specific and is routed along a path described by a centreline.

example.p: A continuously deposited paste that is included in the design may be represented as a Routed_physical_component.

ext_description.p:
specifies a role of the
for the Routed_physical_component.
